doc.field: Carr, Ezra Slocum: Castleton, VT; Cherry Valley, Lockport, New Berlin & Onondaga Hollow, NY
Carr, Ezra Slocum: Castleton, VT; Cherry Valley, Lockport, New Berlin & Onondaga Hollow, NY
14 Letters with Indentation, Notation, Postage & Seals
Addressed To: "Professor [Eben Norton] Horsford, [Assistant State Geologist] Albany, NY," "State Geologist, Moscow, Livingston County, NY"
Sent From: "Ezra Slocum Carr," "Ezra & Jeanne Carr, Pasadena, Los Angeles," [CA]
In Reference To: Academic / Business / Education / Friendship / Personal / Professional; Albany Female Academy; Castleton Medical College; Onondaga Academy

Dr. Ezra Slocum Carr (March 9, 1819 - November 27, 1894) was originally trained as a medical doctor but taught in several scientific fields including agriculture and natural sciences. Carr taught at the University of California at Berkeley and the University Wisconsin, in which he also served on the Board of Regents. One-time California Superintendent of Public Instruction, Carr was a progressive educator, friend, and mentor to John Muir, the Scottish-American naturalist, author, and early advocate of wilderness preservation in the United States. The Carr Family Collection (1870-1936) is preserved at the Pasadena Museum of History Research Library and Archives in Pasadena, CA. In addition, The Papers of Jeanne C. Smith Carr (1842-1903), Ezra's wife, are preserved at the Huntington Library in San Marino, CA.
